results.title: Jack and the beanstalk
results.brief_description: A musical version of the very much loved classic fairytale combining live action with animation. Stars Gene Kelly as Jeremy Keen, a peddler who trades his magic beans for Jack’s cow, Bobby Riha as Jack, and Ted Cassidy as the voice of the giant. A wonderful blending of live actors with animated cartoon characters. Also stars Marian McKnight as Princess Serena.

results.title: Jack and the beanstalk
results.brief_description: A short version of the traditional fairy tale in a new medium of silhouette-color, in which black cut-out puppets are manipulated against a colored background. A recent variation on Lotte Reiniger’s established techniques. Narrated by Deryck Guyler.

results.title: Jack
results.creator_credit: Hollywood Pictures, American Zoetrope, Francis Ford Coppola, Fred Fuchs and Ricardo Mestres
results.brief_description: When a baby is born at ten weeks gestation, he ends up a child living in a man’s body. Kept at home by his parents, Jack is finally forced to enrol in the fourth grade but his physical appearance (as a forty year old man) is the cause of much derision. Confused, and upset, Jack seeks the company of older women whilst being mentored by a caring teacher. A comedy that seeks to convey the multitudinous talents of Robin Williams, “Jack” works must less effectively than its obvious influence “Big” (1988, Penny Marshall), but still succeeds as an intermittently charming comedy about family, childhood and self-acceptance. Cast also includes Diane Lane, Jennifer Lopez, Brian Kerwin, Bill Cosby. Allan Rich.

results.title: Jacaranda Festival

results.title: Jabs and jolts
results.creator_credit: Castle Films and United World Films
results.brief_description: Tongue-in-cheek examination of the sport of boxing and wrestling. Stresses the gentle good humour of inflicting violence on others. Combines an appreciation of beautifully choreographed physical theatre with a genuine affection for the comical aspects of these civil athletic pastimes.

results.title: Jablonski
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Peter Jones and Reevan Dolgoy
results.brief_description: A film on the life of Canadian concert pianist Marek Jablonski. He is seen at a concert debut in Spain, on a visit to his native Poland where he began his piano studies at the age of four, in Montreal playing to an audience of school children, and in Edmonton, where he lives. This is a memorable portrait of a man who lives for music. Note: no reference to music performed. Anecdotal interest only. Photography by Jean-Pierre Lachapelle.

results.title: Jabberwocky (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Simon Fraser University, Thomas Howe and Walt Griba
results.brief_description: Lewis Carrol’s famous nonsense poem has been adapted for the screen in this animated version with a delightful twist. Animated by Elizabeth Canefoot and narrated by Chris Hildred.

results.title: Jabberwocky
results.brief_description: Using Lewis Carrol’s famous poem as a starting point, this film uses an animated sequence of images composed of Victoriana props, toys and games of childhood to create a surrealist fantasy.

results.title: J.D. goes hunting
results.brief_description: The story of an American’s hunting holiday in New Zealand’s Southern Alps. Authentic fishing and hunting scenes are set in magnificent mountain and forest scenery, showing the abundant bird and animal life.
